intro: Muscari mirum, commonly known as the Persian grape hyacinth, is a bulbous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It produces clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from blue to violet, resembling grapes. The plant typically grows to a height of about 10–15 cm and thrives in well-drained soil. It prefers full sun to partial shade and is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens. Muscari mirum is a perennial plant that is relatively easy to grow and can naturalize over time in suitable conditions.
